page.title: 03ECOLOGY RIVER BIRDS FISHING
page.content: The River Ribble meanders through a flood plain near Long Preston.It is a favourite place for fishing and is used by Blackburn,Settle and Long Preston Angling Clubs.Salmon and trout are caught on flys and spinners and live bait and lures used for pike. Cattle and sheep graze the fields around which are defended by the flood banks. Nesting birds include curlew, lapwing,oystercatcher,redshank,snipe, mallard,teal and sandmartin.Flocks of waders come in late summer.Autumn bird numbers can arise to about 2,000 each of lapwing,golden plover and curlew on migration routes. Floods attract a few whooper and bewick swans in winter.
